list_definition.definition: (also adjective) chemistry (symbol Fe) (of) an element that is the most common metal, is very hard, and is widely used for making tools etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The ground is as hard as iron

list_definition.definition: a flat-bottomed instrument that is heated up and used for smoothing clothes etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve burnt a hole in my dress with the iron.

list_definition.mean_english: một hình thức câu lạc bộ gôn

list_definition.definition: to smooth (clothes etc) with an iron

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This dress needs to be ironed

list_ex_of_english: In this way diaspora communities are able to subsume all their disparate histories within a single meta-narrative which irons out all the" wrinkles".
Surely they may join electric irons in the glad rush for freedom?
In most cases, all this will be ironed out without recourse to the tribunal.
I think that these are points which can be ironed out.
The transitional period provides a safeguard, so that many of the problems can be ironed out as we go along.
One suspects, however, that the contributors would argue that 'connections' are entirely different, in which case the definitional ambiguities need ironing out.
I prepared the dinner, got to do the washing in the washing machine and hang it up, and ironing and things.
The cluster irons are shown in red and sulfurs in blue.

strike while the iron is hot
